title: '86 Mets among B.A.T. honorees
subtitle: '86 Mets among B.A.T. honorees
body: NEW YORK -- The lights dimmed. The monitors ringing the grand ballroom of the Times Square hotel brightened with images of the 2005 season, to the soundtrack of baseball's newest upbeat anthem, Bon Jovi's "Have A Nice Day."  The musical choice was an ironic overture for the 17th Annual Baseball Assistance Dinner. Because B.A.T. is all about former and current players who rarely have a nice day.  The support organization, baseball's guardian angel, is moved to brighten the days of members of "the family." Most of its efforts occur under the cloak of privacy. Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
